alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gloucester, southeastern King and Queen, east central Charles City, northwestern York, James City, and north central Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 415 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rustic, or near Norge, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... College Of William And Mary and Kings Point around 330 PM EDT. Williamsburg, Norge, Toano and York Terrace around 335 PM EDT. Queens Lake around 340 PM EDT. Gloucester Courthouse and Hayes around 400 PM EDT. Glenns around 410 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Croaker, Camp Peary, Ewell, Warren Mill, Allmondsville, Clay Bank, Williamsburg Airport, Belroi, York River State Park and Barlows Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Surry; York
